results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows, related to Faà di Bruno's formula (n >= 0 and 0 <= k <= n).
comment: We may prove _Philippe Deléham_'s formula by induction on n. Let P(n,k) = A008284(n,k) and b(n) = A039809(n). For n = 0, Sum_{k=0..0} T(0,k) = 1 = b(1). Let n >= 1, and assume his formula is true for all s < n, i.e., Sum_{k=0..s} T(s,k) = b(s+1).

Then Sum_{k=0..n} T(n, k) = Sum_{k=1..n} T(n,k) = Sum_{k=1..n} Sum_{s=k-1..n-1} P(n+1, s+1)*T(s, k-1) = Sum_{s=0..n-1} P(n+1, s+1) Sum_{k=1..s+1} T(s, k-1) = Sum_{s=0..n-1} P(n+1, s+1) Sum_{m=0..s} T(s,m) = Sum_{s=0..n-1} P(n+1, s+1)*b(s+1) = Sum_{r=1..n} P(n+1, r)*b(r) = b(n+1) (by the definition of b = A039809). (End)

program: tabl(nn) = {A = matrix(nn, nn, n, k, 0); A[1,1] = 1; for(n=2, nn, for(k=2, n, A[n,k] = sum(s=k-2, n-2, P(n, s+1)*A[s+1,k-1])));
